Duplicate the first entry to insert at the beginning
Duplicate the last entry to append at the end
Are you sure to remove %d MHz?
Are you sure to remove the voltage level of %d MHz?
Getting GPU freq table. Please wait.
Failed when getting GPU freq table

This refers to the frequency corresponding to this voltage level.\nThe unit of frequency here is Hz, that is to say, add 6 zeros after the MHz frequency. You can view the frequency in MHz in the previous page.\nIf you don\'t know how many zeros to add, it is recommended to change only the first few digits of the number.
Getting GPU voltage table. Please wait.
This refers to the voltage corresponding to this frequency. You can specify the voltage level to be used for this frequency.\nThe voltage increases from top to bottom.

This is the working frequency of the GPU. You can change the available frequencies in the frequency table by changing this value.\nThe unit of frequency here is Hz, that is to say, add 6 zeros after the MHz frequency. You can view the frequency in MHz in the previous page.\nIf you don\'t know how many zeros to add, it is recommended to change only the first few digits of the number.

This is the working frequency of the GPU. You can change the available frequencies in the frequency table by changing this value.
However, remember to make sure that the frequency can find the corresponding voltage in the voltage table, otherwise, it is impossible to boot the phone.
The unit of frequency here is Hz, that is to say, add 6 zeros after the MHz frequency. You can view the frequency in MHz in the previous menu. If you don't know how many zeros to add, it is recommended to modify only the first few digits of the number.

This is probably the memory bus frequency related configuration corresponding to the GPU frequency. The value specifies the frequency level.\nPlease do not change the value too large (beyond the level given by the default maximum frequency), which may lead to the failure to find the specified level and the failure to boot the device.
ACD may refer to \"auto-calibrating dynamically adaptive clock distribution\"? It seems to be something related to the clock speed adjustment. IDK more about this.

Welcome!
By using this tool, you can edit the GPU frequency table and voltage table of Snapdragon 855, 865, 888 and 765 series processors freely, such as overclocking and undervolt.
The following is an example to illustrate how to do overclocking: First, click "Edit GPU freq table", and it will show the frequency tables in the device. There may be multiple frequency tables in a device. I have annotated the frequency tables, but it may not accurate. So please judge which frequency table your device is using according to the frequency table in various GPU frequency adjustment softwares.
Click a frequency table to show all frequencies in it, and then click "new" on top to copy the max frequency. Then click the copied new frequency to enter the parameter setting page, and click the "frequency" above to modify it according to the demand.
After modification, click "save". After saving, you can click "Edit GPU freq table" again to refresh and view to confirm that the saving is successful.
And then you can click "Edit GPU volt table". At this time, the available frequencies of all frequency tables will be displayed. If the frequency specified by the frequency table is not in the voltage table, it is inevitable that the phone will not able to boot. Then click "new" on top, and the max frequency will be copied. Then click the new frequency to enter it.
Click "frequency" to change it to the frequency previously specified when editing the frequency table. Then, a suitable voltage level can be selected for this frequency.
Click "save" again. After saving, you can click "Edit GPU volt table" again to refresh and view. Confirm that the saving is successful.
After confirming that everything is OK, flash the image and restart the phone.
In a word, please make sure that the frequency in the frequency table exists in the volt table.

Welcome!
By using this tool, you can edit the GPU frequency table and voltage table of Snapdragon 855, 865, 888 and 765 series processors freely, such as overclocking and undervolt.
The following is an example to illustrate how to do overclocking: First, click "Edit GPU freq table", and it will show the frequency tables in the device. There may be multiple frequency tables in a device. I have annotated the frequency tables, but it may not accurate. So please judge which frequency table your device is using according to the frequency table in various GPU frequency adjustment softwares.
Click a frequency table to show all frequencies in it, and then click "new" on top to copy the max frequency. Then click the copied new frequency to enter the parameter setting page, and then edit the frequency and voltage according to the demand.
After modification, click "save". After saving, you can click "Edit GPU freq table" again to refresh and view to confirm that the saving is successful.
After confirming that everything is OK, flash the image and restart the phone.
